The correct answer is B: A white disk icon with a loading bar underneath.
When a hard drive failure is detected in macOS, the system will display a flashing folder with a question mark on the desktop indicating that the startup disk is no longer available. Additionally, a white disk icon with a loading bar will appear on the screen while the system attempts to mount the failed hard drive as a temporary boot volume. This allows users to access the operating system using Recovery Mode.
The action shown on the screen when following the instructions would be option A: Erasing and formatting the SanDisk Extreme 1TB external SSD as “Mac OS Extended (Journaled)” named “Boot Drive”.
